**Description:** PMBOK Communication Management Plan

---

**Communication Management Plan: HR Insights Dashboard Project**

**1. Introduction**

This document outlines the Communication Management Plan for the HR Insights Dashboard project, adhering to PMBOK 7th Edition guidelines.  Its purpose is to ensure timely, effective, and efficient communication throughout the project lifecycle.

**2. Stakeholders and Communication Requirements**

| Stakeholder Group          | Communication Needs                               | Preferred Methods       | Frequency                     |
|---------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|--------------------------|------------------------------|
| HR Leaders (Executive Team) | High-level updates, key decisions, risks, & ROI  | Presentations, Email, Reports | Weekly/Bi-weekly, Major Milestones |
| HR Department              | Detailed updates, task assignments, training      | Email, Intranet, Meetings    | Weekly, As-needed            |
| IT Department              | Technical specifications, integration details       | Email, Meetings, Documentation | As-needed, Milestone Driven     |
| Project Team               | Daily updates, task assignments, issue resolution | Daily Stand-ups, Email, Project Management Software | Daily/Weekly                  |
| External Vendors (if any) | Contractual updates, technical specifications     | Email, Meetings, Documentation | As-needed, Milestone Driven     |


**3. Communication Methods, Formats, and Frequency**

* **Project Management Software (e.g., MS Project, Jira):** Task assignments, progress tracking, issue logging, document sharing.  Daily updates for project team.
* **Email:** Formal communication, announcements, distribution of reports and documents.  Frequency varies per stakeholder.
* **Intranet:** Project updates, announcements, training materials, access to documents.  Weekly updates.
* **Meetings:** Daily stand-up meetings for the project team, weekly status meetings with HR leadership, and other meetings as needed.
* **Presentations:** High-level updates for executive stakeholders at major milestones (e.g., kickoff, completion).
* **Reports:** Weekly progress reports, monthly performance reports, final project report.


**4. Information Distribution and Access Procedures**

* A centralized document repository (e.g., SharePoint, Google Drive) will be used for all project documents.
* Access control will be implemented based on stakeholder roles and responsibilities.
* Version control will be maintained using the project management software and document naming conventions (e.g., document name_version number).


**5. Escalation Procedures and Communication Protocols**

* Issues will be logged in the project management software.
* Minor issues will be resolved by the project team.
* Major issues will be escalated to the project manager.
* Critical issues will be escalated to the steering committee (HR leadership).
* Communication of escalated issues will follow a predefined escalation protocol, documented in a separate escalation matrix.


**6. Meeting Management and Reporting Structures**

* Meeting agendas will be distributed in advance.
* Meeting minutes will be documented and distributed to attendees.
* Reporting structures will follow a hierarchical approach, with regular reporting to upper management.
* Regular project status reports will be generated and distributed to stakeholders.


**7. Communication Technology and Tools**

* Project Management Software (e.g., MS Project, Jira)
* Email (Outlook, Gmail)
* Intranet (Company's internal portal)
* Video Conferencing (Zoom, Microsoft Teams)
* Document Repository (SharePoint, Google Drive)


**8. Document Management and Version Control**

* All project documents will be stored in a centralized repository.
* Version control will be managed using the project management software.
* A document naming convention will be used to ensure clear identification of versions.


**9. Performance Reporting and Status Communication**

* Weekly status reports will be provided to the project sponsor and steering committee.
* Monthly performance reports will be generated and distributed to relevant stakeholders.
* A final project report will summarize project outcomes and lessons learned.


**10. Crisis Communication and Risk Communication Procedures**

* A crisis communication plan will be developed and documented separately, outlining procedures for handling unexpected events.
* Risk communication will be an ongoing process, with regular updates on identified risks and mitigation strategies.


**11. Communication Performance Measurement and Feedback**

* Communication effectiveness will be measured through stakeholder satisfaction surveys and feedback sessions.
* Regular reviews of the communication plan will be conducted to identify areas for improvement.
* Feedback from stakeholders will be used to refine communication strategies and processes.


**12. Roles and Responsibilities**

* **Project Manager:** Overall responsibility for communication management.
* **Communications Lead (if applicable):** Supports the PM in communication activities.
* **Stakeholders:** Responsible for providing feedback and participating in communication activities.


This Communication Management Plan will be reviewed and updated as needed throughout the project lifecycle.  Any changes will be communicated to all relevant stakeholders.
